definition: to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Avoid winking at someone from Chinese Hong Kong, because it's considered rude.
sentences.chinese: 別對中國的香港遊客擠眉弄眼，他們會認爲這很粗魯。

sentences.english: I'm tellin' ya that girl totally winked at me.
sentences.chinese: 我跟你說啊，那小妞確實是向我擠眉弄眼了。

sentences.english: Da eyebrow eye of SAO walk, as I make faces.
sentences.chinese: 我臊眉耷眼的走了，正如我擠眉弄眼地來。

sentences.english: Soapy went up to the woman, and made eye at her.
sentences.chinese: 索比走向那個女人，對她擠眉弄眼。

definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
